ARABIC: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ ٱلرَّجْفَةُ فَأَصْبَحُوا۟ فِى دَارِهِمْ جَٰثِمِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: So the earthquake seized them and morning found them lying flattened in their homes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Then they were seized by an earthquake, and lay overturned on the ground in their homes in the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Thereupon a shocking catastrophe seized them, so that they lay prostrate in their dwellings.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Suddenly, an earthquake jolted them and they were left motionless in their homes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Therefore the earthquake seized them, so at morning they remained lying flattened in their homes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So the earthquake seized them, and they lay (dead), prostrate in their homes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then the earthquake overtook them, so they became motionless bodies in their abode.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: So the earthquake seized them, and morning found them in their habitation fallen prostrate.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: So the earthquake seized them, and morning found them prostrate in their dwelling-place.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: So the earthquake overwhelmed them, and morning found them prostrate in their dwelling places.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Whereupon an earthquake seized them, so that they lay prone in their dwellings.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Thereupon the earthquake seized them, and they lay lifeless prostrate in their homes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: So the earthquake took them unawares, and they lay prostrate in their homes in the morning!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So the earthquake seized them, and they lay (dead), prostrate in their homes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Thereupon the earthquake seized them, at morning in their dwellings they were crouched, dead.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Whereupon the quake overtook them, and they became lifeless bodies in their homes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So the earthquake seized them, and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [7:78] So the Trembling, a violent earthquake and a cry from the heaven, seized them, and they lay lifeless prostrate in their habitations, keeled over their knees, dead.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (So the earthquake) and the loud noise announcing their torment (seized them, and morning found them prostrate) dead without a movement (in their dwelling-place) in their town.
